abstract: Prosecutors inform Aws Mohammed Younis Al-Jayad, Iraqi refugee accused of supporting terrorist organization, that evidence gathered from government's warrantless surveillance program forms part of case against him; Jayad's case joins handful where constitutionality of program and legal basis, FISA Amendments Act, which revised Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act, are being questioned.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors have told an Iraqi refugee accused of traveling to Syria to help a terrorist group that he faces evidence derived from a program in dispute.

headline.main: Warrantless Surveillance in Terror Case Raises Constitutional Challenge
headline.print_headline: Disclosures in Cases Put Surveillance in Question

snippet: Prosecutors have told an Iraqi refugee accused of traveling to Syria to help a terrorist group that he faces evidence derived from a program in dispute.
